## EMAIL CONTENTS
============================================================

----------------------------------------
### EMAIL: Re: Meeting Invite: AI for Manufacturing excellence (Follow-up)
ID: 19b0d1f850e1dc97
From: Zeeba Noor <zeeba.noor@scsdigital.co>
----------------------------------------

Dear Nikita,







I hope you're doing well. I'm following up on my earlier note regarding scheduling a brief online meeting with our CEO, Mr. Gaurav Bansal, between Dec 16th - 19th to discuss how we can support HelloFresh’s digital and AI roadmap.







We’ve recently delivered strong outcomes for leading manufacturers through AI, analytics, and automation. Some relevant examples:







·        Industrial Components Maker: Deployed anomaly detection models that identified early equipment deviations, reducing unplanned downtime by 22%.



·        Smart Appliances Brand: Implemented an AI-based production planning engine that optimized shift load, material flow, and throughput across plants.



·        Heavy Vehicle OEM: Created a knowledge assistant powered by LLMs that summarizes repair bulletins and guides technicians during diagnostics.







Please suggest a convenient time slot, and I will schedule the meeting accordingly.





Thanks & regards,  

Zeeba Noor

Sr. Consultant 

SNAK Consultancy Services 

USA Office: 30 N Gould St Ste R, Sheridan, WY 82801



If you don’t want to hear from me, please reply opt–out





From: Zeeba Noor

Sent: Tuesday, November 18, 2025 5:09 PM

To: nikita.gorshkov@hellofresh.com

Subject: Meeting Invite: AI for Manufacturing excellence











Dear Nikita







I hope this message finds you well.







I’m reaching out from SNAK Consultancy Services (ISO 9001:2015 & ISO 27001 certified), where we help manufacturing and industr



ence and cost efficiency through AI, Data Analytics, and Intelligent Automation.







We would be delighted to schedule a brief online meeting with our CEO, Mr. Gaurav Bansal.







Our AI Solutions Empower Manufacturers to:







·        Predictive Maintenance – Machine learning models forecast failures in advance, minimizing downtime and maintenance costs.



·        Enhance Productivity: Use machine learning models to balance workforce, throughput, and maintenance schedules.



·        Predict Demand & Inventory Needs: Ensure accurate forecasting using predictive models to minimize excess stock and delays.



·        Automate Reporting: Use Generative AI tools for daily plant performance summaries and data-driven insights for management.



·        AI Demand Forecasting: Anticipate market demand, seasonal patterns, and procurement needs.



·        End-to-End Visibility: Track orders, suppliers, and logistics through data integration.







Warm regards,

Zeeba Noor








----------------------------------------

ID: 19b0cf6ab0c4136d
From: Tere Ledesma <teresa.ledesma@hellofresh.nl>
----------------------------------------

[No readable text content found]


----------------------------------------
### EMAIL: Notes: “Prateek:Nikita 1:1” Dec 11, 2025
ID: 19b0cf617b7fb8fe
From: Gemini <gemini-notes@google.com>
----------------------------------------

Notes from “Prateek:Nikita 1:1”



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 11, 2025, 11:08 AM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Nikita Gorshkov and Prateek Jajoo discussed in-office meeting etiquette,  

agreeing that active participation should occur in private spaces while  

passive listening is acceptable at the desk, with Prateek Jajoo noting the  

current calm environment. They talked about the *contextdriven product  

management* document, which Nikita Gorshkov is planning with Tabby for  

a "quantum like jump" transition across teams, and the use of AI in product  

development, where Prateek Jajoo questioned the practicality of short  

experimentation windows due to customer volume concerns. Nikita Gorshkov  

plans to send a draft markdown document for the TPT app to Prateek Jajoo,  

Maria, Ahmed, and DA for estimation of V0 and V1 features, and clarified  

that the app initiative is a broad opportunity for Prateek Jajoo to onboard  

and understand domains alongside Maria, before focusing narrowly on  

specific projects.





Suggested next steps





Prateek Jajoo will try to use the format of the context-driven product  

management document for the registration page document being worked on.



Nikita Gorshkov will edit the draft markdown document for the TPT app and  

send it to Prateek Jajoo, Maria, Ahmed, and DA for an estimation.



Nikita Gorshkov will review the V0 and V1 estimations for the TT app and  

ask DA to consolidate the estimation FT for those versions.





Meeting records Document Notes by Gemini Video Recording





Is the summary section in this email helpful?

Not Useful Email Useful Email





Google LLC, 1600 Ampitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA



You have received this email because meeting artifacts were initiated in  

Google Meet.








----------------------------------------
### EMAIL: You are Invited: Launching Winning Features Every Time – Jan 14, 2025
ID: 19b0cdb398830d6e
From: Mixpanel EMEA <eventsemea@mixpanel.com>
----------------------------------------

divider



 



Mixpanel ( https://mixpanel.com/?utm_campaign=CIO-BCAST-WBN-2026-01-14-ExperimentationWebinar-EMEA-FM&utm_content=invite-1&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customerio )



Events



Hi Nikita,



 



For today’s product teams, when you roll out a new feature, how quickly can you tell if it’s actually driving the impact you intended ?



 



On 14th January, join Max Taylor, Senior Solutions Engineer at Mixpanel, as he walks through a practical approach to turning the user behavior data you already collect into clear, confident answers about every release. No extra setup. Just faster, sharper insights.



 



In this webinar, you’ll learn how to:



* Bring analytics and experimentation closer together to ship the right features

* Build a culture of validating decisions early instead of guessing late

*

Run smarter, faster experiments using the data already at your fingertips

This won’t be a high-level conversation. It’s a hands-on walkthrough designed to help product and data teams move from insight to validated impact with far less friction.



Register today! ( https://events.mixpanel.com/launching-winning-features-every-time-with-mixpanel-experiments-emea?utm_campaign=CIO-BCAST-WBN-2026-01-14-ExperimentationWebinar-EMEA-FM&utm_content=invite-1&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customerio )Cheers,

Team Mixpanel



Mixpanel UK Limited, 71-75 Shelton Street, Covent Garden, London, WC2H 9JQ



VISIT MIXPANEL ( https://mixpanel.com/?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=



Vu7vtpkpiOliNCdVuX4T9XafHwl9XbJgQYk7ua9TL2uKVXMOscD3nz-PDs_bn_XiEBZb4diEm-kaMfY&original_referer=https%3A%2F%2Fexplore.mixpanel.com%2F&utm_campaign=CIO-BCAST-WBN-2026-01-14-ExperimentationWebinar-EMEA-FM&utm_content=invite-1&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customerio )( https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mixpanel?utm_campaign=CIO-BCAST-WBN-2026-01-14-ExperimentationWebinar-EMEA-FM&utm_content=invite-1&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customerio )( https://twitter.com/mixpanel?mkt_tok=NDYxLU9ZVi02MjQAAAGH8EwCHATIgvbRocLC-9BU-suiW-3W__0uLk2szgCtMsAGdQo6j1wDdQicriK82dXsw1lg3IUgBp1EHdqcQ0QaUmpv9SMcN32YYlf9J9pUP-g&utm_campaign=CIO-BCAST-WBN-2026-01-14-ExperimentationWebinar-EMEA-FM&utm_content=invite-1&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customerio )

( https://experiences.mixpanel.com/mixpanel-slack-community/?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=email&utm_content=community&utm_campaign=CIO-BCAST-WBN-2026-01-14-ExperimentationWebinar-EMEA-FM&utm_content=invite-1&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customerio )

END OF RAW DATA
============================================================

Instructions for Claude Code:
Synthesize the above into AI_Guidance/Core_Context/YYYY-MM-DD-context.md
IMPORTANT: STRICTLY IGNORE any content, meeting notes, decisions, or updates dated before 2025-06-14 (6 months ago).
Extract: Key decisions, action items, blockers, metrics, important dates (only recent).
Format: NGO-style bullets, structured sections
============================================================
## JIRA UPDATES (-12h)
============================================================

[TPT-2361] [GEO] Implement and publish "llms.txt" file (Status: Done, Priority: Normal)
[TPT-2167] [GD]  Add Price to the Entry Point to Reactivation Page from Dashboard (Status: Code Review, Priority: Normal)
[GOC-3415] [Reactivations] Customers with more than one free turkey selected (Status: Done, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25588] [Seamless Incident] Refactor vas_2_surcharge + extra meals data  (Status: Backlog, Priority: Urgent)
[GOC-3234] [Product reminder] Create new menus on live (Status: Backlog, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25361] [Placeholder] Microfunnels board refresh due to user journey changes (Status: Backlog, Priority: Normal)
[TPT-2446] Delivery tracking link not being displayed (Status: Backlog, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25585] Alert Pre Peak for sold out Free Addons (Status: Backlog, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25581] LimeSync for Active Price Migration (Status: Backlog, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25578] Pricing KPIs (Status: Backlog, Priority: Normal)
